headline: Great Northern War begins
description: Major conflict between Russian and Swedish Empires affecting Northern European politics and trade
impact_on_science: Disrupts academic exchange between Nordic countries and affects funding for scientific institutions

headline: Kingdom of Prussia declared
description: Frederick I establishes Kingdom of Prussia, creating new center of political and academic power
impact_on_science: Establishes Berlin as emerging center for mathematics and science, future home to Berlin Academy

headline: War of Spanish Succession begins
description: Continental European war involving most major powers over Spanish throne
impact_on_science: Disrupts communication and travel between European scientific centers

headline: St. Petersburg founded by Peter the Great
description: New Russian capital established, becomes center of scientific academy and mathematical excellence
impact_on_science: Creates major new center for mathematics - future home to Euler and St. Petersburg Academy

headline: Act of Union creates Kingdom of Great Britain
description: Scottish and English Parliaments merge, establishing unified British academic and scientific institutions
impact_on_science: Unifies British scientific institutions, strengthens Royal Society and university system

headline: Death of Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb
description: Fragmentation of Mughal Empire begins, affecting trade and scientific exchange with Europe
impact_on_science: Affects Indo-European mathematical and astronomical knowledge exchange

headline: Great Frost of 1709
description: Coldest winter in 500 years affects European politics and contributes to Swedish defeat
impact_on_science: Extreme weather affects travel and communication between European academies

headline: World's first copyright legislation enacted
description: Britain's Statute of Anne establishes intellectual property rights
impact_on_science: Protects scientific and mathematical publications, encourages scholarly writing

headline: Treaty of Nystad ends Great Northern War
description: Russia emerges as major European power, consolidates control over Baltic region
impact_on_science: Stabilizes Northern Europe, allows resumption of academic exchange and travel

headline: Peter the Great abolishes slavery in Russia
description: Major social reform converts household slaves to serfs
impact_on_science: Part of broader Russian modernization that includes founding of Academy of Sciences

headline: Catherine I dies, Peter II becomes Tsar
description: Political instability as 11-year-old becomes Russian ruler
impact_on_science: Academy of Sciences seeks stability by recruiting foreign mathematicians like Euler

headline: Anglo-Spanish War begins
description: Maritime conflict between Britain and Spain over trade routes
impact_on_science: Affects transatlantic scientific communication and specimen collection

headline: First Great Awakening begins
description: Religious revival movement in Britain and North America
impact_on_science: Influences intellectual climate and relationship between science and religion

headline: War of Polish Succession begins
description: European powers fight over Polish throne succession
impact_on_science: Disrupts Central European academic networks and universities

headline: Qianlong Emperor begins 60-year reign
description: High Qing era of cultural and territorial expansion begins
impact_on_science: Golden age of Chinese science and mathematics, Jesuit scientific exchange

headline: Nader Shah sacks Delhi
description: Persian invasion of Mughal India, massive wealth transfer
impact_on_science: Disrupts Indo-Persian mathematical and astronomical traditions

headline: War of Jenkins' Ear begins
description: Britain and Spain fight in Caribbean over trade disputes
impact_on_science: Affects colonial scientific expeditions and natural history collection

headline: Great Irish Famine kills 20% of population
description: Devastating famine affects Irish population and economy
impact_on_science: Affects Trinity College Dublin and Irish intellectual life

headline: War of Austrian Succession begins
description: Major European conflict over Habsburg succession
impact_on_science: Disrupts German and Austrian universities, affects Habsburg patronage of sciences

headline: First Saudi State founded
description: Mohammed Ibn Saud establishes Wahhabi state in Arabian Peninsula
impact_on_science: Affects Islamic mathematical and astronomical traditions in Arabia

headline: Second Jacobite Rising begins
description: Charles Edward Stuart leads Scottish revolt against British rule
impact_on_science: Disrupts Scottish universities and intellectual life

headline: Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle ends War of Austrian Succession
description: Peace treaty restores stability to Central Europe
impact_on_science: Allows resumption of academic travel and correspondence across Europe

headline: Peak of Little Ice Age
description: Coldest period of Little Ice Age affects global climate
impact_on_science: Stimulates interest in meteorology and climate observation

headline: Britain adopts Gregorian Calendar
description: British Empire switches calendars, skipping 11 days
impact_on_science: Standardizes dating system for British scientific observations and correspondence

headline: French and Indian War begins
description: North American theater of Seven Years' War begins
impact_on_science: Affects colonial scientific expeditions and natural history studies

headline: Great Lisbon Earthquake
description: Devastating earthquake destroys Lisbon, kills up to 100,000
impact_on_science: Stimulates early seismology studies and Enlightenment philosophical debates

headline: Seven Years' War begins
description: Global conflict involving all European great powers
impact_on_science: Major disruption to European academic networks and scientific correspondence

headline: British conquest of Bengal
description: Battle of Plassey establishes British dominance in India
impact_on_science: Begins systematic British collection of Indian mathematical and scientific knowledge

headline: George III becomes King of Britain
description: New monarch begins 60-year reign during scientific revolution
impact_on_science: Patron of Royal Society and supporter of scientific expeditions

headline: Battle of Panipat
description: Maratha Empire suffers major defeat, reshapes Indian politics
impact_on_science: Affects Indian mathematical traditions and astronomical schools

headline: Catherine the Great begins reign
description: Catherine II becomes Empress of Russia, rules until 1796
impact_on_science: Major patron of sciences, expands St. Petersburg Academy, recruits Euler back

headline: Treaty of Paris ends Seven Years' War
description: Peace treaty reshapes global colonial empires
impact_on_science: Restores peaceful academic exchange across Europe, enables scientific expeditions

headline: Stamp Act imposed on American colonies
description: British taxation leads to colonial resistance movement
impact_on_science: Affects American colonial colleges and scientific societies

headline: Christian VII becomes King of Denmark
description: New Danish monarch begins reign amid enlightenment reforms
impact_on_science: Supports Danish scientific institutions and Arctic expeditions

headline: Russo-Turkish War begins
description: Russia and Ottoman Empire clash over Black Sea control
impact_on_science: Affects Eastern European academic networks and travel routes

headline: James Cook explores New Zealand and Australia
description: First European mapping of New Zealand and Australian coast
impact_on_science: Major scientific expedition advancing navigation, botany, and cartography

headline: Bengal Famine kills one-third of population
description: Devastating famine under British East India Company rule
impact_on_science: Affects Indian mathematical and scientific communities

headline: Gustav III stages coup in Sweden
description: Swedish king becomes absolute monarch after bloodless coup
impact_on_science: Affects Swedish Academy of Sciences and Linnean institutions

headline: First Partition of Poland
description: Austria, Prussia, and Russia divide Polish territory
impact_on_science: Disrupts Polish universities and forces migration of scholars

headline: Pugachev's Rebellion begins
description: Largest peasant revolt in Russian history
impact_on_science: Threatens stability of Russian Empire and Academy of Sciences

headline: American Revolutionary War begins
description: Thirteen Colonies rebel against British rule
impact_on_science: Involves scientist-politicians like Franklin, affects transatlantic scientific exchange

headline: United States Declaration of Independence
description: American colonies declare independence from Britain
impact_on_science: Creates new nation with emphasis on scientific progress and education

headline: Adam Smith publishes The Wealth of Nations
description: Foundational work of modern economics published
impact_on_science: Establishes political economy as scientific discipline

headline: Franco-American Alliance signed
description: France enters American Revolutionary War against Britain
impact_on_science: Facilitates French-American scientific cooperation, Franklin's diplomatic role
